boardgame.name: Deck Destroying Game
boardgame.description:
This is a card game with 72 cards.

In Deck Destroying Game, each player has a Personal Deck containing 10 cards with numbers 3 to 9 on them. Throughout the game, some of these cards will replace by worse cards of the "General deck" (with numbers 0 to 2 on them).

The game will be played in turns. Each turn, players play up to 3 of their in-hand card(s) simultaneously and the winner takes one of the played cards as reward.

Each card shows from one to three gem icons which are victory points of the game. At the end of the game, the player with most gem icons is the winner of the game.

boardgame.name: The Fabled Sword
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

In The Fabled Sword, a group of level-10 characters finds out the location of a legendary blade known as Holy Judgment. The blade belonged to a renowned paladin, Sir Helena Abrax. She was a member of the White-Hearted Knights order. A religious organization devoted to the protection of the dispossessed and the eternal fight against demons and other monsters from hell. Benevolent gods gifted the holy sword to Sir Helena and she carried out her duties with it until her order was vanquished by treacherous demons.

Since then, the sword Holy Judgment has rested near Sir Helena's remains in an old tomb that few people know about. The few well-informed individuals that have tried to retrieve the sacred sword from the vault many times failed. Undead guardians and underground denizens roam the vault. If the characters gain access to Holy Judgment's resting place, they still have to negotiate with the paladin's spirit. Only a worthy individual shall wield the fabled sword!

boardgame.name: Solluna
boardgame.description:
Anglais

In this epic pixeled card game, players will use cards to raise or lower the Village's influence level, trying to secure a powerful mythical stone, the Atris Lucidum.

But before that, players will secretly pick a Heroes of Legends card, that changes the objective depending on which Hero you get. Solaris heroes will want the influence type to be Sol at the end of the game, while Lunaris heroes will want it to be the Luna type. Neutralis heroes will want to keep the influence level low, no matter the type.

Then, each player will draft 9 Prestations cards, pick one of them and pass the rest of the pack to the next player. Players will again have to pick a card from that now 8 cards pack, and pass the rest to the next player, and so on until there is no cards to pass.

Finally, players will play 1 card at their turn. Most cards will help raise or lower the influence level, but some of them can make a player skip a turn, cancel another card effect or power up another one.

The game ends when a player has no card to play, or if the influence level reach 20 (or more). Then, the winners are decided depending on the type and level of the influence.



Dans ce jeu épique de cartes pixelisées, les joueurs utiliseront des cartes pour augmenter ou diminuer le niveau d'influence du village, en essayant de s'emparer d'une puissante pierre mythique, l'Atris Lucidum. Mais avant cela, les joueurs choisiront secrètement une carte Héros des légendes, qui modifie l'objectif en fonction du héros choisi. Les héros Solaris voudront que le type d'influence soit Sol à la fin de la partie, tandis que les héros Lunaris voudront que ce soit le type Luna. Les héros Neutralis voudront que le niveau d'influence reste bas, quel que soit le type.

Ensuite, chaque joueur va tirer 9 cartes Prestations, en choisir une et passer le reste du paquet au joueur suivant. Les joueurs devront à nouveau choisir une carte dans ce paquet de 8 cartes, et passer le reste au joueur suivant, et ainsi de suite jusqu'à ce qu'il n'y ait plus de cartes à passer.

Enfin, les joueurs joueront une carte à leur tour. La plupart des cartes permettent d'augmenter ou de diminuer le niveau d'influence, mais certaines d'entre elles peuvent faire sauter un tour à un joueur, annuler un effet de carte ou en renforcer un autre.

Le jeu se termine lorsqu'un joueur n'a plus de carte à jouer, ou si le niveau d'influence atteint 20 (ou plus). Ensuite, les gagnants sont désignés en fonction du type et du niveau d'influence.

boardgame.name: Thrones & Bones Locations Maps: Norrøngard City Maps
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to Norrøngard

A land beset by undead horrors, marauding trolls, mercurial spirits, and monstrous beasts. In such a danger-fraught and challenging environment, heroes emerge to perform deeds worthy of the skalds, and those who don’t meet an early demise as a troll’s breakfast or a linnorm’s lunch carve out new domains or conquer existing ones.

Featuring the work of acclaimed roleplaying games cartographer Robert Lazzaretti, Norrøngard City Maps presents a map of the country of Norrøngard as well as 9 city maps from the Thrones & Bones: Norrøngard 5e campaign setting. Included are maps for the Norrønian cities of Aarvik, Bense, Herkeby, Korjengard, Nilmgard, Oslendholm, Sindholm, Umsborg, and Wendholm. Maps are presented in both jpg format for VTT use and in CMYK png format for printing.

boardgame.name: Core Space: Wanted – Dead or Alive
boardgame.description:
Lurking in the grey area between good and evil are the Bounty Hunters, powerful new NPCs tasked with hunting people, for a price! If your name is on their list you’d better beware, or at least have the cash to pay them off! This expansion adds these new characters to the game along with a range of auxiliary companions. They’re not just NPCs either – they are all fully playable as a part of your crew!

The new narrative campaign will see you trying to stay alive while there’s a bounty on your head, and new Event Cards, character boards and equipment will integrate these characters into the game.

Requires the Core Space Starter Set to play.

boardgame.name: Looting For Fun and Profit in the Modern World
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Fantasy adventurers have it easy.

Nobody thinks twice when Sir Russell, Paladin of the Holy Light, and his travel companions claim the wealth of their vanquished foes. Some might say it is the birthright of every successful adventurer to claim as their own the belongings of those evildoers they stop. It’s not like that farming village or local magistrate can afford to pay a decent wage.

boardgame.name: Spiders!
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

The party sits around the campfire, resting up from a hard day of questing and planning how they intend to handle their upcoming battle with the dragon. As someone reaches for another piece of wood to throw on the fire, the biggest spider they have ever seen scurries out of the hollow log. No big deal, right? After all, a party of hardened adventurers wouldn’t be scared of a spider, right? Even if it is the size of a small rabbit.

Don’t be so sure.

boardgame.name: Bullet Ant
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Imagine a sting so extreme that the pain is said the be the equivalent of being shot with a bullet, but lasts for 24 hours? Meet the Bullet Ant, an insect with the dubious honor of having the most painful sting in the world.

boardgame.name: Cassowary
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

In the grant scheme of the natural world, humans tend not to look at birds as an actual threat. With the exception of a certain Hitchcock film, birds aren’t generally the first thing people think of when they consider dangerous animals. But at over 5 ft tall and 150 lbs, the endangered Cassowary is regarded as the world’s most dangerous bird. And for very good reason.

boardgame.name: Fossa
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

It looks like a primitive cat. It moves like a squirrel. It attacks with the ferocity of a bobcat. And some speculate tiger-size versions may yet prowl the land. The Fossa is a peculiar, and dangerous, creature.

boardgame.name: Solenodon
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

The Solenodon is a strange mammal related to the hedgehog. At less than 3 lbs and fewer than 2 ft long, one would hardly consider this nocturnal forager a dangerous creature. That is, until one is bitten by the Solenodon. It is one of the few real-world mammal that has a poisonous bite, secreting toxic saliva that can affect the nervous system and cause excruciating pain.

boardgame.name: Sea Wasp
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

For most adventurers, the first time they find themselves overboard at sea the immediate fear is sharks. But while they search the horizon for the telltale dorsal fin, an almost invisible creature lurking below them could cause a painful, quick end to even the sturdiest adventure.

Meet the Sea Wasp.

boardgame.name: Aye-Aye
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

At one time, the Aye-Aye was believed to be related to the raccoon. It has a rodent-like face and a tail shaped like a squirrel’s. But the Aye-Aye is actually a primate. This nocturnal forager feeds off of nuts, fruit, and grubs. The creature has an unusual method of foraging scrubs. It taps on the trunk or heavy branch of a tree looking for the grubs. When it find them, it gnaws through the bark until it reaches the grubs, and then uses its abnormally long fingers to dig out the grubs and eat them. The creatures live high in the canopy of warm forests and jungle climates, deftly jumping from tree to tree in search of food.

boardgame.name: A Matter of Honor: A Micro-Adventure
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

A Matter of Honor? is a micro-adventure that can be played out in an 30 minutes or less. It can be used as a filler for those times when a player is unavailable to game or running late and the party doesn’t want to continue the main storyline without him or her. It can also serve as an early side adventure for your newly formed party.

boardgame.name: A Stealthy Thief: A Micro-Adventure
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

A Matter of Honor? is a micro-adventure that can be played out in an 30 minutes or less. It can be used as a filler for those times when a player is unavailable to game or running late and the party doesn’t want to continue the main storyline without him or her. It can also serve as the impetus that unites a group of new adventurers together in the first place.

boardgame.name: The Dad Class: Happy Father's Day!
boardgame.description:
User summary:

This item presents the "Dad" class, a comical - but playable - implementation of the role and function of father as a D&D-style class.

boardgame.name: You Always Knew Mom Had Class... But 20 Levels? Happy Mother's Day
boardgame.description:
User summary:

This item presents the "Mom" class, a comical - but playable - implementation of the role and function of mother as a D&D-style class.

boardgame.name: The Psions of The Grandmaster
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

During World War II, a young psionic Jewish prisoner in a concentration camp finds himself locked in a battle of wills with a powerful psion Commandant determined to turn him against his own people. Unable to defeat his foe in direct psionic combat, he agrees to place the fate of everyone in the camp, as well as his very soul, on the line in a chess match. This is The Grandmaster, an amazing novel by author Peter A. Balaskas.

This special free download presents the two main characters of the novella as NPCs for use in your own campaigns. It also includes a free excerpt from the novel.

boardgame.name: The Lifebringer
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

The Lifebringer (LBR) is a vessel of Mother Earth Incarnate, channeling the life-giving energies of the world around her. Though death is a natural part of the life cycle, The Lifebringer’s goal is to ensure that each sentient being is given their full measure of life. Each living creature has a purpose, and to cut short a life is to deny it the chance to fulfill that destiny. As such, Lifebringers recoil at the notion of taking a life, and instead seek to find peaceful resolutions to problems.

boardgame.name: Karmic Adversary: Necromancer
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Karmic Adversary: Necromancer is a supplement designed for the Karma Role-playing System. Karmic Adversary offers the Storyteller a detailed, pre-generated NPC that can be used as a one-time story arc or a recurring foe. Everything the Storyteller needs to use the NPC is in this supplement. No need to jump to different sourcebooks to look up information. Spell lists, magic item stats, related monster encounters, and equipment are all here.

boardgame.name: Live Laugh Lose
boardgame.description:
Get ready for Live Laugh Lose, the adult party game where you compete to make your friends laugh using only the world's corniest jokes. Delivery cards get you to tell bad jokes with funny deliveries. For example, you may have to read the following joke in a Siri voice: "The person who invented knock-knock jokes should get a no-bell prize." Your team scores if you get the opposing team to laugh! Bad jokes have never been funnier.

Adults Only: This game contains mature content and is designed for ages 17+. It is not intended for children. Trust us on this one. Encouraged to be played with 2+ players.

Each player starts every round with 3 Joke
Cards and 1 Delivery Card in hand. Before a new round, draw fresh cards and put the old ones in a "used" pile.
Players take turns trying to make the opposing players laugh by reciting 1 of the 3 Joke Cards in their hands.
After the joke is told, the 5-second "Quiet Period" begins. The joke teller counts down on their fingers. The opposing players must not laugh during the "Quiet Period" in order to win the point. If they laugh, the joke teller wins the point. If the opponents don't laugh, they each get a point.
The first person to get 11 points wins the game!

boardgame.name: Races of Neiyar: Amphikin
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Amphikin stand about 2 feet tall, with females slightly taller and heavier. They have both lungs and gills (just behind the ear holes) and are thus equally at home on land or in the water.
boardgame.rpgsetting: Neiyar: Land of Heaven and the Abyss

boardgame.name: Flex NBA
boardgame.description:
FLEX doesn't change the game - FLEX is the game!

Flex NBA is the very first Battle Tile and Augmented Reality (AR) board game that fuses professional sports with the latest in augmented reality technology. Created in partnership with the NBA and NBPA, FLEX NBA lets fans play as their favorite NBA players, using their FLEX 'superpowers' to take down opponents!

The game comes with 10 NBA player tiles, from which each of the 2 players drafts a team of 5 tiles. Players also have the option to purchase expansion sets that include additional NBA player tiles so that they can build their collections. Players don't need to watch actual NBA games in order to play the game. The game mechanic itself is similar to many other TCG's out there (although because of our NBA license we can't call ourselves a TCG - hence why we refer to ourselves as a BTG - battle tile game).

Once players have assembled their lineups, they then take turns rolling the play action die and taking actions based upon the results of the roll. There are additional status FX tiles that enhance the player's move set and give them various competitive advantages. With many of the moves that a player makes (aka Flexes), they will whittle down the other player's confidence points (health) until the opponent's team is depleted of CP.

The mobile companion app integration serves 2 primary purposes - 1) it is necessary to view the player tiles' AR animations, and 2) it is necessary if players wish to register the unique bar codes on their player tiles to our database and thereby claim ownership (per our NBA license, we cannot use the words NFT or blockchain, but that's what it actually is).

boardgame.name: MindMonsters
boardgame.description:
MindMonsters is a fun, story-based adventure card game for people living with anxiety and stress. The goal of the game is for your Hero to get calm and stay calm when facing monsters on an epic journey. Players learn to Think Like a Hero — to focus their power to see a situation for what it is, consider options, and make the best of it.

The game is cooperative and is for 1-3 players. A player will start by choosing a Hero card, deciding what Play Style (class) they want, and a fill-in story card. Each fill-in story card has fill-in the blank lines that you will choose a word for based off of what cards you draw each turn. The games lasts for 6 chapters (rounds).

Depending on their Play Style, the player will draw different cards. They then decide if they want to trade cards, and if they have any cards they can match to be able to unlock the letter for that chapter's story. If they don't unlock a letter, they can spend a mimo (action point) at the end of their turn to buy one. You get 4 mimos each turn, and if you don't use any or all of them, they carry over to the next chapter.

Then, every player draws a monster card, Magicians will try to befriend the monster, Collectors will try to collect them and Warriors will try to fight them.

You win by succeeding in as many monster encounters as possible, the monsters add to your Hero's overall strength. Whatever mimos you have left over by the 6th chapter also add to your Hero's strength. The 6th chapter card is a Boss Monster, you defeat it with your accumulated strength.

boardgame.name: Spooky Stories to Play in the Dark
boardgame.description:
"“Why is Hocus Pocus a great Dungeons & Dragons Adventure? What’s the biggest challenge of running Coraline? What spell is essential to running Paranorman? In “Spooky Stories to Play in the Dark” we give advice for running horror games for younger players (8-12): scariness levels, content discussion, and pacing help. We then go through seven popular and well-known kids' horror/Halloween movies and give tips for adapting them to D&D adventures. Finally, we include a “Recommended Reading” list of young reader horror books from the last 10 years for further gaming inspiration.

Happy Gaming!"

(Author Summary)

Dawn of the Undead - zombie shooter and survival game
Dawn of the Undead - Zombie-Apokalypse: ein Spiel ums Überleben

boardgame.name: Escape Adventures Wendepuzzle: Schwerelos
boardgame.description:
The players are part of a crew on a spaceship searching for extraterrestial life. Just as they encounter an alien spaceship, several important systems fail, putting the life of the whole crew in danger. Will the aliens help or pose an additional threat?

Escape Adventures is played in two phases: First, the players have to piece together a two-sided, round puzzle. Than they begin to solve puzzles. Some of them require to turn the whole puzzle around, as some important information is only found on one of the sides.

A booklet contains the story of the game that develops as players solve more puzzles. To see if they solved the current puzzle correctly, players use special puzzle tiles to see if their solution forms a continuous line of a specific color.

The game aims to bring the experience of an Escape Room to the home of the players. It can be played multiple times as no material gets destroyed while playing.

Wild Life Rescue - Kinderspiele: Tiere finden & behandeln
Wild Life Rescue - Quest to Hunting and Saving Creatures
Wild Life Rescue - Save Wildlife: Find out & Heal Animals

boardgame.name: Rooby's ABC
boardgame.description:
Come fly with Rooby Roo as you learn your ABCs. Rooby's banners show each letter in both uppercase and lowercase, and the order they follow in the alphabet.

In Rooby’s ABC, players take turns drawing one of the 26 letter tokens from the bag, they then place them on one of the five public alphabet boards with the matching letter (each board contains 4 to 6 unique letters of the alphabet). When a player completes a board, they collect a Rooby token, and the player with the most Rooby tokens when all the letters have been played wins the game.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: A Battle Through History
boardgame.description:
In A Battle Through History, each player wears the clothes of a time-traveling storyteller whose journey through historical eras enables them to relive epic battles alongside legendary troops and heroes. During a game, players play era tiles into the "Gear of History" to customize their deck of cards and move their character in space and time in order to fight and recruit troops from different historical battles or challenge opponents in player vs. player combat. As you build an army made of soldiers from different ages, you use it to collect relics from different places and times. Whoever collects the greatest units and the bravest heroes, leads them to victory, and gathers relics during their travels wins the game.

A Battle Through History, designed and published by Scribabs and released worldwide by Pegasus Spiele, is the official Sabaton board game, featuring a unique "gear and rack" action system, fight-based deck-building, 60 different historical troops, and eight famous heroes from different eras.

boardgame.name: Sine Requie Anno XIII: Inquisizione
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:
Venite a conoscere com’è nata e quali ideali animano la Santa Inquisizione, toccate con mano il ruolo complesso di Conversi e Secretari: salvatori o aguzzini? Angeli o demoni?

English translation:
Get to know how the Holy Inquisition was born and which are its ideals, experience first-hand the complex role of Conversi and Secretaries: saviors or torturers? Angels or demons?

boardgame.name: Dura-Lande: Regolamento
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:
Dura-Lande è un gioco di ruolo Ecopunk.
Le Dura-Lande sono una piccola frazione del Mar Mediterraneo, 301 anni dopo la Poliorcesi.
La Poliorcesi, una spaventosa guerra tra multinazionali, svoltasi nel 2051, ha frammentato l’umanità, e ha ridotto il mondo in fin di vita.

English translation:
Dura-Lande is an Ecopunk RPG.
The Dura-Lande are a small fraction of the Mediterranean Sea, 301 years after the Poliorcesi.
The Poliorcesi, a terrifying war between multinationals, which took place in 2051, has fragmented humanity, and reduced the world to the point of death.

boardgame.name: Dura-Lande: Ambientazione
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:
Dura-Lande è un'ambientazione Ecopunk.
Le Dura-Lande sono un mondo governato dall'economia.
Le Dura-Lande sono un luogo di oppressioni e privilegi.

English translation:
Dura-Lande is an Ecopunk setting.
The Dura-Lande are a world governed by the economy.
The Dura-Lande are a place of oppression and privilege.

boardgame.name: Purple Haze
boardgame.description:
You look at the wrecked Huey, thankful you survived the crash. It got hit somewhere over the jungle. You lost the pilot. The gunner just fell out. Gone. On your way down you saw a glimpse of the other Huey. You think it got hit too, but you can't be sure. You look around at your squad — wild-eyed Marines fresh out of boot camp — and sigh heavily. You gotta move fast. VC will be coming...

Purple Haze is an immersive story-creation campaign game for 1 to 4 players that drops you into the heart of darkness: Vietnam, 1967. You lead a squad of U.S. Marines through the dense jungles, flooded rice paddies, and straw-thatched villages of a war-torn country. Gut-wrenching choices will determine the fate of you and your mission, showing if you have what it takes to survive.

It is in part a story-creation game, in part a tactical combat game, and in part a campaign game. Your decisions determine the story. Your tactics decide the outcome of life and death firefights. Your men will suffer. Some won't make it home. Those that do will get wiser, get tougher. The goal: Complete the mission, and get out alive.

Walk through dacya islands, buy gate medallions of the matching element to enter in different Wyvern Islands.

It's all about speed and skill, gather as much points as you can during your journey and return at least one egg so you can survive the fall of dacya and the mighty Wyverns and be victourious against the other players.

boardgame.name: Vengeance of a Burned Witch
boardgame.description:
From the publishers blurb:

A witch that had been burned returns. Her bones need to be recovered. A contract needs to be destroyed. An otherworldly ally of hers has to be faced. Where? How? Try to learn that from the panicking villagers. It is the only way to learn it. Vengeance of a Burned Witch is a one-session side-quest where talking to the NPC is vital for solving the adventure as a whole. It is not a big affair, and it has in-build set-backs to deliberately frustrate the players a bit. But in the end, success will be so much more sweeter for it. ...oh, did I mention that no riches and no impressive magical items are to be gained? And that it is yet not a “nega-dungeon”? Take my word on it.

boardgame.name: Bag of Ice
boardgame.description:
Bag of Ice is an abstract push-your-luck game, played with Looney pyramids, where players compete to be the first one to reach 60 points.

On their turn, players draw pyramids from a bag until they bust by drawing a red pyramid, or voluntarily stop drawing. If they stop, they receive points based on the stacks of pyramids they can assemble and the sizes of the remaining pyramids.

boardgame.name: Character Examination
boardgame.description: Character examination is a one shot roleplaying game in which the players take on the roles of a group of RPG characters who have developed interpersonal conflicts and have sought out help to resolve them. One person takes on the role of referee and also plays the helper who varies by setting but sis someone who always decides to have a form of group therapy to get people talking and airing their grievances so they can move on.

boardgame.name: 1000 Year Old Elf
boardgame.description: In this game you will imagine yourself as an elf with a very long lifespan. It is a solo sandbox game. There are themes of skill, loss, and weariness. You need 2d10 of different colors or a pair of percentile dice, pencil and paper.

boardgame.name: Monsters Messed Up My Room
boardgame.description:
In this 2-4 player game that lasts 30-60 minutes, you take on the role of a child who must clean up their room. While it may be a chore to clean your room, you have monster friends that you can use to cause mischief and hinder your opponents!

The first player to clean their room ends the game, but the player with the cleanest room wins!

Each turn you have to make the most of your three actions as you place cleanup Tokens and Play Chore cards. While keeping your opponents in check with Monster cards.

The game ends when there are no Mischief cards left to draw or if a player removes their last Messy Room token. If you have the most Cleanup Tokens you win!

boardgame.name: Green Deal
boardgame.description:
Green Deal is a strategic cannabis themed card game, for 2-6 players, where your strategy gets busted anyways. This action-packed game takes you directly into another Universe.

Build your Green Business by collecting pairs and gain points with every Deal. But be careful, you’ve to watch out for Donut-Cops, Aliens, Thieves. Protect yourself with the help of Skunks, playing Hide or with the good old corrupted Donut-Cop. You think you are winning the Game? Within the Green Universe you should never be too sure.

Gather your most beloved family members, friends, frenemies and strangers for a game full of laughter, rivalry and revenge.

Do you have what it takes to become the Master of the Green Universe?

boardgame.name: Citadelles: Route Mythique Mini Extension
Citadels: Scenic Route Mini Expansion
boardgame.description:
Set of 14 new district cards

New rules excerpts: Facedown districts have no building cost or effects, but they do count towards your completed city.

Some cards affect components in the box. Keep unused components nearby when playing with these cards.

Each card has different card text affecting the game in different ways.

Promo available with purchase of the new 2021 edition of the game in participating outlets.

The 14 cards are:

Architects' Guild
Avant-Garden
Ballroom
Clockworks
Consulate
Dragon Roost
Excavation Site
Festival Ground
Forum
Labyrinth
Royal Coffer
Shadow Chamber
Sinkhole
Trade Bridge

listing.notes: new in shrink. English version. Shipping is 7 euros for this item
Spanish version

boardgame.name: Robotopia
boardgame.description:
The Master Robot rules Robotopia with an iron fist - literally! Rebellion is brewing, and the robot guilds are looking for a new leader. Do you have what it takes to run the factory?

Robotopia is a worker-placement game about robots who want to rule. Each player is an ambitious robot working to usurp the Master Robot and take control of the factory.

Each round, you’ll place a robot on a factory location. This robot will stay at work on the board, and no longer belongs to you. The robot will activate any factory spaces it touches to collect resources, build generators, and influence the robot guilds. The bigger the robot, the more spaces it can use. When you run out of robots, power your generators to build more and move the Master Robot around the factory to crush robots into resource cubes.

Gain influence with the robot guilds by spending resources and completing schematics. The game ends once a player has achieved influence with all four of the robot guilds. The first player who does this, wins the game!

boardgame.name: Eden
boardgame.description:
Author's blurb:

Eden is a rules light Table Top Role Playing Game that uses a d100% (d10 and d%) system. It takes what other systems would spend pages upon pages explaining and boils it all down to the brass tacks. It gets to the point so you can spend more time actually playing the game instead of having to refer to rules all the time. The system is fast and exciting as well as easy to pick up! But beware, as it is difficult to master. Beautifully illustrated pages with linen texture and UV coating.

A malleable world set in 1500 C.E., 9,000 years after the fall of Atlantis. Full of Myths and Legends, Gods and Monsters, Heroes and Villains. Eden can be as in depth or as simple as you allow. Quality writing flows throughout each page. Included with purchase is a printable page used to create one shots for Eden with an easy to follow structure. Also included is the Deck of Consent, a stack of seven cards used to aid players in letting the GM know how they are feeling within the moment during play.

boardgame.name: War Within RPG
boardgame.description:
UNRELEASED GAME




This game has not been released yet, therefore some of the information above may change in the future. Until this game is released, please don't submit images for it unless given direct written permission from the publisher which must be noted in the image caption.




Publisher's blurb:

War Within RPG is a roleplaying game set in a tense Cold War arena. Based in the 1980s in an alternate reality it has been thirty years since a great war tore the world apart. Each player takes on the role of a country’s leader alongside a team of Trusted Aides, making decisions on behalf of their people. A Nuclear Non-proliferation Treaty hangs over the world. Three of the Non-Player Governments have access to nuclear weapons, two of which were at war. They have agreed to not use their nuclear weapons and to not help others acquire them. But their government types are opposed, and tension grows. The players, as new leaders of their countries, find themselves in a fragile Cold War. Will they survive the coming storm?

boardgame.name: Car Wars (Sixth Edition): Dropped Weapons Pack
boardgame.description:
This is a 4-player expansion for Car Wars Sixth Edition that allows you to add dropped items to your car builds. Now you can litter the arena with devious gadgets and deadly weapons!

The expansion includes the following:
-One counter sheet (four rectangular slab tokens and one with 16 rectangular foam tokens, as well as 32 circular mine tokens)
-108 game cards
-Rule sheet

boardgame.name: Der Herr der Ringe: Das Kartenspiel – Neuauflage
The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game – Revised Core Set
Le Seigneur des Anneaux: Le Jeu de Cartes – Edition révisée
O Senhor dos Anéis: Card Game (Revised Core Set)
El Señor de los Anillos: El Juego de Cartas – Caja Básica Ed. Revisada
Il Signore degli Anelli: Il Gioco di Carte – Revised Core Set
魔戒：卡牌游戏
boardgame.description:
Sometimes, in order to truly appreciate a tale, one must first go back to its beginning. Grand adventures and strong fellowships are important and wonderful, but the first step of any journey is just as important as the last. With that in mind, it’s time to return to the beginning of one of the most epic adventures of all…

With increased contents and some quality-of-life improvements, this new version of the classic LCG’s core set is the perfect opportunity for a new player to dive into the game.

The Revised Core Set includes cards to allow Campaign Mode (previous core set was strictly standalone scenarios), entirely new Boon and Burden mechanics that add cards that persist with the players from scenario to scenario, and full support for 4 players in the core box.

-description from publisher

boardgame.name: Poof the Game
boardgame.description:
Poof the Game is a family friendly card game designed for all ages and types of gamers. It is easy enough for children to play with friends or parents but also a great casual game to enjoy with more seasoned gamers as it features elements of strategy not found in most well-known card games.

The goal is simple: get rid of all your cards before your opponents do.

Be careful, the cards you have at the end of a round will add up until the game is over!

But what's a game without a twist?! Wait until the time is right to make the cards go poof...make your move...get the upper hand.

Short-script gameplay: Players play cards equal to or lower than the player before them in clockwise rotation until they run out of cards. All the cards left in a player's hand at the end of a round get added up to their total score and the person with the lowest score at the end of 7 rounds wins the game.

Sounds simple enough, right? Wrong! There are hidden cards in a player's hand that aren't revealed until the card on top of them has been played. There is also the magic of the "POOF!" Whether it's a Poof card or playing a 4 of a kind, players have the opportunity to re-set the cards in the playing area and start over with any number they'd like!
boardgame.commerceweblink: Geek Game Shop listing for Poof The Game

boardgame.name: Tarot of Servants Companion
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

The Tarot of Servants is a supplement for Bluebeard’s Bride, a tabletop roleplaying game of supernatural horror set in a familiar fairy tale. The game is a little different than the story, in that a group of players explore Bluebeard’s home together as the newest Bride and create their own version of the dark tale.

User summary:

Designed to accompany Tarot of Servants.

boardgame.name: Duel sur l'Écume
boardgame.description:
The two players play Surcouf, the Corsair, or Blackbeard, the Pirate. The two crews face each other with cannon shots symbolized by the rolls of the dice.

The object of the game is to decimate the crew of the opposing ship and then to sink it. Dice roll combinations will hit either the opposing crew or the opposing ship.

A new feature is the box serves as a dice track with bonus and penalty areas. Landing dice throws in these areas will take skill.



L'un des 4 jeux du coffret Jeux Pirates et Corsaires Légendaires. Au contraire des 3 autres jeux du coffret, celui-ci est une création originale.Les deux joueurs incarnent soit Surcouf, le Corsaire, soit Barbe Noire, le Pirate. Les deux équipages s'affrontent à coup de canon symbolisés par les jets de dés.

Le but du jeu est de décimer l'équipage du navire adverse puis de couler celui-ci.

L'originalité de ce jeu réside dans le fait que la boîte elle-même sert de piste de dés ayant des zones de bonus et de malus. Donc il est nécessaire de faire preuve d'adresse lors des lancers de dés.

Les combinaisons de chiffres des dés atteindront soit l'équipage, soit le navire adverses.

boardgame.name: Route East
boardgame.description:
Race from Istanbul to Shanghai in an incredibly fun board game filled with tense gaming frustration, strategy and co-player vendettas. Based on a trip of a lifetime, Route East takes players across mountains, valleys, and stunning wonders of the less explored areas of the world while testing their planning and cunning skills.

At the start of each turn, you pick an Ignition card and then you play your three moves. How you play them is up to you - you might decide to move on the board, or pick or play Action Cards that will give you various advantages throughout the game. You might also have to roll the dice to move depending on the circumstances.

Plan your route through must-see attractions along the way, and develop a strategy based on budget, fuel, cunning and pure foul play! First one to Shanghai, you got it, wins!

It won’t be easy. Did we mention this before?
1) you’ll definitely not have enough money - that’s guaranteed
2) Your teammates will steal from you, bribe their way through borders, and damage your car so badly you’ll be stuck for days without moves
3) Early front-runners get the brunt of abuse - have you not heard that slow and steady wins the race?
4) Play dirty or be kind. Become your competitors’ best ally or screw everyone over and make a dash for the finish.

You'll need an equal mix of skill, planning, and bloody savviness to get to Shanghai first.

boardgame.name: Car Wars (Sixth Edition): Road Tiles
boardgame.description:
This supplement for Car Wars Sixth Edition allows you to create custom arenas and scenarios. Add these new cards to your core set and mix and match the road tiles to make a variety of new arena designs!

This supplement includes:
-18 two-sided chipboard tiles
-30 game cards
-One counter sheet (turning keys, control tokens, ace tokens, and damage tokens)

boardgame.name: Darkest Dungeon: The Dark Tapestry
boardgame.description:
A stitched neoprene mat, designed specifically to work with the components of a regular dungeon. It fits your standard 27x27 dungeon tiles, and is designed to play a campaign on it.
This neoprene playmat is NOT designed to fit the Color of Madness expansion setup.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Darkest Dungeon: The Darkest Organizer
boardgame.description:
A place to organize and store all your tokens! The Darkest Organizer is a plastic storage box for all the tokens of the Ancestral Pledge. It features 25 spaces for you to store all over 300 various tokens from the Darkest Dungeon: The Board Game and all its expansions.
—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Darkest Dungeon: The Darkest Heroes
boardgame.description:
The Darkest Heroes box consists of alternate sculpts for each of the heroes in the game, complete with the hero cards, skill cards, and stance tokens that are necessary… all with alternate artwork on them!

Please note: The Musketeer promo Hero is NOT included in this box.

boardgame.description:
The Heirloom Chest of Loot provides cosmetic upgrades that you can use both in your game, as well as for dioramas and showcasing.
COMPONENTS BREAKDOWN:

1 Fabric Bag for loot tokens (black with red logo)
9 Double-sided Cardboard Location Backgrounds

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Canvas: Premium Components Pack
boardgame.description: Upgraded components for Canvas. Contains 20 wooden inspiration tokens, 100 wooden ribbon tokens and 5 easels with folding kickstand for card display.

boardgame.name: Cepheus Journal (Issue 008)
boardgame.description:
From the website description

Welcome to issue #008 of the Cepheus Journal. This is a Retro Sci-Fi issue.

Our editors have written two articles: one about the Space Force outlining some Area 51 style adventure seeds and an article outlining how to build characters and adventures for a Space Patrol style game.

Steve Attwood wrote an article about Orbital 2100. Norton Glover sent us an article about Martians for the Cepheus Engine. Brass Jester has updated an article about solo play (that originally appeared on the Freelance Traveller website.) In A R Kavil’s article you can read about Lethal Hits for Cepheus Engine.

We have part 2 of Jo Jaquinta’s The Raiders Lament story, as well as his look at what a future galaxy might bring to gaming. Finally, Brett sat down and had a virtual chat with Independence Games John Watts, a great bloke with some great games.

We have also added a map of Lancaster Subsector (where the Travellercon/USA is held.)

boardgame.name: Kingscraft
boardgame.description:
Kingscraft is a boardgame, that compresses the feeling of a classic RPG adventure into a game of around an hour.

The story is, that the king is in search for a heir to his throne, that is equal to his own power. So he announces, that everyone in his kingdom may challenge him to a fair duel. And the first one to win, will be the new king. So adventurers from all over the country start building their equipment - in hope of becoming the new king.

Each turn the players chose one of seven actions-cards and place them face down on the table. Then the actions are revealed, placed in clear determened turn-order and then executed. Depending on the chosen actions they take items from the board, fight monsters (dice-rolling) to get better loot and craft items together to get new advanced equipment.

In the centre of the game there is a transformable crafting-tree, where all players are trying to get the best equipment, by getting rewards for killing monsters and crafting different items together to get new and stronger ones.

The game is is won by the first player who dares to fight the king and who succeeds in doing so.

boardgame.name: Willie Weeties football game
boardgame.description:
Willie Weeties Football was an Australian promotional game found on the back of Weeties Cereal boxes during the 1950's. Produced by the National Biscuit Company, now known in Australia as Nabisco, the game is an adaptation of Australian Rules Football.

Two players are on opposing sides, either red or yellow teams. Players spin a numbered spinner and take turns in moving their playing piece towards their goal along a numbered path set on a football ground. Along the way certain numbered spaces assist or slow progress towards goal. When a player's piece nears goal they have a chance to spin and shoot for goal. The player with the most goals after a designated time is deemed the winner.

boardgame.name: Creationary: Travel Edition
boardgame.description:
Welcome to the world of fast LEGO building where you try to correctly guess who built what!

Players select a card from the stack and all players race to build the image out of Lego. The player who builds best, wins the card. The player with the most cards at the end of the games wins.

Contains:
100 Creation cards
30 Two-point cards
20 One-point cards
1 Sixty-second sand timer

You will need to provide your own LEGO bricks.

This game was made available through the LEGO VIP program.

boardgame.name: Truth or Drink: On The Rocks
boardgame.description:
Expands the original Truth or Drink: On The Rocks deck into a Standalone version. 432 all-new questions guaranteed to shake things up. The set uses the rules from the from the Second Edition of the base game.

Are you prepared to dive deep below the surface of your friendships?

Chill questions for mixed company—with just enough of a bite to help you loosen up together.
boardgame.boardgameimplementation: Truth or Drink: The Card Game

boardgame.name: FlickFleet: A Box Of Flicks 2
boardgame.description:
FlickFleet: A Box of Flicks 2 is the third expansion for FlickFleet and consists of 28 all new elements that can be used to create bigger fleets and more exciting battles. The base game is required to play.

As with the base game and previous expansions, there is a deluxe and standard version. The deluxe edition includes engraving on all the pieces.

7 new Pirate elements
6 new Uprising elements
6 new Imperium elements
1 new Neutral element

As well as:
- Aged Ships
- Technicians
- Wreckage
- Comets
- Nebula
- Hyperspace Kraken
- ECM Field Template
- Dice
- Rulebook

boardgame.name: The Taverns of Tiefenthal: BGHQ Tokens
boardgame.description:
These tokens are to replace some of the cardboard and other tokens in the Taverns of Tiefenthal board game. They come already printed in multi-colors so you DO NOT have to paint anything.

Full Set (34 tokens):
1 Beer Mug Player Turn token
1 Moon Round Marker
4 White Star Reputation tokens
4 Brown Beer Barrel tokens
4 Yellow Safe tokens
20 Schnapps tokens

boardgame.name: Heroes & Villains
boardgame.description:
Meteors composed of strange, exotic matter have devastated the planet. From the ashes, a few survivors have emerged with amazing, and sometimes terrifying, abilities! Some have come to defend the weak while others are set on conquering all they see. The battle for the future of humanity has begun.

Heroes & Villains is a superhero/villain-themed deck battle game for 2 to 6 players. Players use either preconstructed or their own customer battle deck of ability cards. The battle deck is both your strength and your life. Deplete all of the cards in your opponent's battle deck before exhausting your own and win the battle for ultimate supremacy!

To begin play, each player chooses one of the six powers types to play. Each power has a corresponding Destiny Card that gives you the option to play as a Hero or Villain. Your choice empowers you with a unique bonus skill that can be used once per game) to give you a unique advantage in battle. Players can either use the pre-separated/pre-shuffled Power Deck for their character or assemble their own customize deck containing a unique blend of attacks and defense.

At the beginning of your turn, draw a card (max 5), and use your 4 Energy Points to Deploy Power Cards onto the BattleField, or to Active the Power of an already deployed card. Use a balance of Tactics, Minions, Weapons, and Assaults to deplete your opponent’s deck and to restore your own.

Be the last man standing to be declared the winner, and the Ultimate Comic Book Hero/or Villain.

boardgame.name: World Rally Championship 8
WRC 8
WRC 8 FIA World Rally Championship
WRC 8 FIA 월드 랠리 챔피언십
WRC 8: The Official Game
boardgame.description:
WRC 8, also known as WRC 8 FIA World Rally Championship, is the official game of the 2019 World Rally Championship. The game was developed by French developer Kylotonn and published on 10 September 2019 by Bigben Interactive for Microsoft Windows, PlayStation 4, Xbox One and Nintendo Switch.[1] The game carries an official World Rally Championship esports licence.

Source: Wikipedia, "WRC 8", available under the CC-BY-SA License.
boardgame.videogameversion: Xbox One | Xbox Series downloadable edition

boardgame.name: KÖ-ØP
boardgame.description:
KÖ-ØP is a two-player, co-operative card game about assembling furniture with a partner.

Each player starts the game with a secret needs card that tells them which "love languages" they need to score to be satisfied in the relationship. On their turn, players attempt to communicate the love languages they need by pointing at cards in their partner's hand. Players then use these cards to build their furniture. The game ends after players have attempted to build three pieces of furniture.

Players must earn at least one meatball in order to win, with meatballs being earned based on the number of needs cards satisfied and the complexity of the furniture players chose to build. The more meatballs the players score, the better their end result.

boardgame.name: Lost Ruins of Arnak: Solo Mini Expansions
boardgame.description:
This expansion adds two new mini-modules for the Lost Ruins of Arnak solo experience. These modules can be used separately or in combination, and are available for free both as a print-and-play (available on the CGE website) or online in the solo app at https://solo.arnak.game.

The Rival Objectives expansion adds more urgency to your solo game by adding unique goals for the Rival.

The Purple Actions expansion increases the difficulty of the solo game by giving your Rival more formidable actions.



=

Print-and-play components are designed to be printed as cards that are added to the Lost Ruins of Arnak solo game. You can print them on cardstock, or you can print them on paper and insert them into card sleeves (41 × 63 mm, Mini American).

The online components can be found at https://solo.arnak.game after clicking on the “PLAY SOLO” button.

- description by the publisher

boardgame.name: Cooper Island: The Skilled Workers
boardgame.description:
For those who want to bring a little more variety to Cooper Island, there is now this mini expansion.

The Skilled Workers consists of 6 postcards that replace the traditional worker tableaus. Each of them is individual, so you will have a slightly different game experience with each of them.

listing.notes:
new
Check out my other items and bundle and save on shipping

boardgame.name: World Rally Championship 9
WRC 9
WRC 9 FIA World Rally Championship
WRC 9 The official game
boardgame.description:
WRC 9, also known as WRC 9 FIA World Rally Championship, is the official racing video game of the 2020 World Rally Championship. The game is developed by French developer Kylotonn and published by Nacon. It is available for Microsoft Windows, Nintendo Switch, PlayStation 4, PlayStation 5, Xbox One and Xbox Series X/S, released on 3 September 2020.

Source: Wikipedia, "WRC 9", available under the CC-BY-SA License.
boardgame.videogameversion: Xbox One | Xbox Series downloadable edition

boardgame.name: Green Oaks
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:
Green Oaks è una stupenda struttura immersa nel verde dove coloro che sono giunti all’inverno della loro vita possono trovare diverse attività ricreative, nuove amicizie e tutta la professionalità di personale infermieristico di altissimo livello.
Corre voce che nei sotterranei di Green Oaks si nascondano grandi tesori, ma c’è anche chi pensa che in realtà l’intera struttura sia una base aliena dove vengono fatti esperimenti sugli Anziani.

English translation:
Green Oaks is a beautiful facility where those who have reached the winter of their life can find various recreational activities, new friends and all the professionalism of top-level nursing staff.
There is a rumor that great treasures are hidden in the basement of Green Oaks, but there are also those who think that the entire structure is an alien base where experiments are carried out on the Elders.

boardgame.name: Half a Dozen More Handimonsters
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Half a Dozen More free monsters for 5e from Handimonsters

This PDF collects a second set of six free monster releases from Handimonsters.com. Handimonsters provides a brand new original 5e monster each week and access to a vault of dozens of ready-to-run monsters.

The Handimonsters team consists of award-winning designers and artists like Jacob Rodgers, Jon Hodgson, Scott Purdy, special guest designers, and layout by Paul Bourne.

In addition to our weekly monsters, we also have a package that includes virtual tabletop tokens, printable paper minis, and art cards. Every monster has beautiful and original art and description to inspire your games and challenge your players!

boardgame.name: Bardo
boardgame.description:
Bardo ("Flame War") is a real-life app where we will talk about EVERYTHING! The chat got heated. Display the menu of viral topics: everyone has their opinion and the fight is starting. We can make a big deal, make a mess or talk nonsense, know what we are talking about or not have a clue. All's fair in this game. Get ready for trolling in the group by playing your best cards.

Objective: Follow the conversation and discard the most Bardo cards throughout the game rounds. The winner is whoever runs out of cards first, or who has the least amount at the end of 3 rounds.

Deal 7 Bardo cards to each player. Put cellphone camera spots (Bardo cards background) on the table according to the number of players, to mark how many Bardo cards will be played each round. Choose a viral theme to talk about, from the menu or select one yourself.

A player starts playing one of their cards on a Bardo spot, and talking about the theme relating it to the Bardo card (by theme, feelings, or any way is valid). Words in the table cannot be mentioned, and a card would be taken as penalization if done. The player can be interrupted by other after 5 seconds or when they finish the idea. The interrupting player plays a new Bardo card, and has to answer or discuss the previous speech.

When all spots are covered, the round ends. The played cards are shuffled in the deck, and a vote is made (except on the last round) to penalize the most incongruent player on the round, with each player receiving an additional card for each vote they received against them.

The winner is whoever runs out of cards first, or who has the least amount at the end of 3 rounds.

boardgame.name: World of Darkness: Ghost Hunters
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The abandoned lover, waiting for her paramour to return, only to die, alone. Now she waits in her house forever.

The murdered family, killed in a spree so violent their spirits couldn’t pass on to the hereafter, now wreaking an untampered revenge on anyone they find.

The serial killer, who never made his tally complete in life, now determined to possess the bodies of the living to continue his gruesome campaign.

These ghosts, and more, haunt our world. They watch us, they torment us, they play with us, they find themselves locked in Sisyphean cycles, where the only respite comes through the haunting of the living.

It is our role to hunt these spirits down. Some believe we’re laying them to a deserved rest. Others hunt for the renown and to put down the homicidal dead. Others believe they’re doing God’s work, or with every hunt, their knowledge of the paranormal world increases.

We are ghost hunters, and regardless of our motives, it is our task to ensure the dead may no longer torture the living.

Ghost Hunters includes:


A broad, deep history of ghost hunter cells, and catalogue of weapons and artifacts ghost hunters might use in the World of Darkness.
Playable options among the hunters that fight with bullets and blades, and those who fight with belief and supernatural power. Alongside them, those hunters who would track, cage, and study the dead.
A wide array of story hooks and rich storytelling advice for those who wish to run a game of Ghost Hunters set alongside any of the World of Darkness games.
An appendix containing a selection of antagonists your ghost hunters may come to face.

boardgame.name: Knight For Revenge
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

An invisible enemy is killing a group of people developing a new children's restaurant. Can the secret agents of CROSS solve the mystery before the killer strikes again?

This product is a 4-page mission for Secret Agents of CROSS. Use as-is or expand to your liking.

boardgame.name: Immortals: Rules for Divine Beings
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This book provides rules for running aspects of divine beings in your First Edition Pathfinder Roleplaying Game. It provides:


Rules for divine ranks
New and updated salient divine abilities
Discussion of combining divine ranks, epic levels, and mythic tiers
Running a divine game
A new prestige class allowing player characters to ascend to godhood

boardgame.name: Skies of Steam and Iron: Airships for your Campaign
Skies of Steam and Iron: More Airships and Artillery for your Campaign
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This short document adds super artillery - cannons with bore sizes larger than 20 inches - and a few new airship classes.

boardgame.name: The Ooze (M&M)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

"Indescribable...

Indestructible!

Nothing Can Stop it"

- Movie Post for The Blob (1958)

From Jacob Blackmon comes a new creepy (but also familiar) foe ready to menance your M&M game!

The only thing that Ooze avoids is the cold, especially extremely cold temperatures, which can slow or even freeze it entirely. The Ooze shies away from the cold, aware that it cannot survive in freezing temperatures. If the Ooze goes more than 1 day without being able to consume new organic matter, it drops into a form of hibernation. In this inert form, it resembles a simple mass of gelatinous goo. However, as soon as the Ooze senses living prey nearby, it springs to life and quickly moves toward the source of food.

The origins of the Ooze are left to the imagination of the Game Master. Perhaps it came from a meteor from outer space. Maybe it originates from the depths of the Earth itself. Perhaps, like natural fossil fuel, the Ooze is a living byproduct of the ancient dinosaurs seeking to reclaim the Earth from the mammals that came afterwards.

boardgame.name: Frontier Trading Post
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This is an adventure for use with Cepheus Engine.

On the outer fringes of the sector a few outposts exist which allow buying and selling of goods which are not normally found in the more populated systems. Smugglers, pirates, criminals and other unsavory people are drawn to places like this. Aliens and humans alike co-exist in such places on the outer rim of civilized space.

boardgame.name: Puzzle Memo Ozean
boardgame.description:
The game board shows an ocean in which the animals are just shown as shadows. Under the board, face-down tiles are placed in a random order.
On a player's turn, they reveal a tile and can place it on the board (if the space under it is already occupied) or put it face-down above the board (trying to remember where it is). A player can always choose to reveal a tile from above or below the board.

When a player manages to complete the picture of a sea creature, they move forward on the score track.
When the ocean has been completely revealed, the player with the highest score is the winner.

boardgame.name: Dragonville
boardgame.description:
Dragonville is a quick and simple strategy board game for ages 7+.

The Queen Dragon of Dragonville woke up one morning to find all her eggs missing. She soon discovered that her enemies had scattered her eggs around the forest. She has called upon the trusted champions of Dragonville to retrieve her eggs, and fast! “I will reward you all, my clan! Bring as many and as quickly as you can. Some combinations also fetch you more if you plan,” she instructs.
​
Are you going to be thorough, quick, or specific? What's your strategy?

Players race to collect eggs and be the first to complete the course. On their turn, players decide to either move up to two spaces OR roll the dice for a chance to move up to five. Landing on an egg spot first allows the player to pick up the egg.

The game ends when the first player reaches the end of the forest. The player with the maximum points wins the game.

boardgame.name: Taifun
boardgame.description:
The players set their meeples in the center space and take turns rolling the die. Only at the roll of 1, the player has to move his meeple to the red dot of the inner circle. from this point on, he has to move clockwise after every roll. If he gets on a space connected to next ring, he has to change to that ring on his next turn. On the third ring there is a space which allows movement back to the first ring (connected with an arrow). On the fourth ring, there are spaces that cause the meeples to fall from the wheel and be taken out of the game.

The last player to remain on the board wins the game.

The boards where published without a box and without meeples and dice. Title and rules where glued to the back of the board.

boardgame.name: Truth or Bull
boardgame.description:
Truth or Bull is a tactical bluffing and deduction game for 3-10 players.

The Game: Take turns to peek at the Target card. Get maximum points by putting down a card closest to the Target card AND by fooling the majority.
​
But what’s in the Target card? Lie about it or tell the Truth, that is your choice, but the others get to vote and call Bull!

The winner is the player with the maximum points after all players get to be the Active Player.

boardgame.name: Run Shark Run
boardgame.description:
Run Shark Run is a cooperative board game for kids aged between 5 and 13, where all players play together as a team against the Shark.

Players choose a card from the deck and play a card from their hand to move on the board.

Choose and play your cards wisely to go around the board and collect the treasure before the Shark gets to your boat to win the game.

boardgame.name: Lockout Monster
boardgame.description:
Lockout Monster is a cooperative board game for kids aged between 5 and 13, where all players play together as a team against the Monster.

Roll the dice and decide where to move the two knights. Collect the right combination of locks and keys and lock all the castle gates one by one before the Monster gets in to win the game.

boardgame.name: Oh, The Horror!
boardgame.description:
"A Horribly Hilarious Horror Card Game!"

Every player is dealt 7 cards face down from the Method of Death deck. The oldest person in the room (i.e. the one closest to death) will assume the role of "Death Dealer."

At the top of each round, the Death Dealer will turn over one Killer and one Victim card from the top of the deck. The remaining players will all play one of their methods in an attempt to create the funniest or most gruesome (usually both) combination. This is decided on by the Death Dealer. Once the Death Dealer decides the winner of that round, the victim is given to the victor and it is added to that player's "body count." How many bodies is enough? Whatever it takes to make the players feel satisfied in their blood-lust.

Players will need to overcome several unique challenges in gameplay such as Plot Twists (cards that alter gameplay mechanics for Players and Death Dealers alike), Guardian Angels (cards that steal rounds from other Players), and Death Itself (cards that randomize gameplay in unexpected ways.)

Once the round is concluded, the person counter-clockwise to the first Death Dealer becomes the new Death Dealer and play resumes.

boardgame.name: Car Wars (Sixth Edition): Miniatures Set 1
boardgame.description:
This expansion for Car Wars Sixth Edition adds new miniatures and cards giving you new weapons and equipment customization options for your vehicle builds.

This expansion includes::
>Five miniatures: Scimitar, Joseph Special, Pillbug, Hades, and Hydra. Miniatures are pre-assembled and unpainted.
>148 cards (weapons, accessories, upgrades, structures)
>Car Wars Sixth Edition Colored Bases SJG 2424 - Four colored bases (red, yellow, blue, and green)

boardgame.name: Power Modifiers
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This Savage Worlds RPG release brings you Powers Grimoire: Power Modifiers. Using Power Modifiers to adjust how powers work in your game is part of the fun, so we have expanded the options available to you!

Includes 15 New Power Modifiers and 1 Addended Power Modifier to use in your games.

boardgame.name: Car Wars (Sixth Edition): Miniatures Set 3
boardgame.description:
This expansion for Car Wars Sixth Edition adds new miniatures and cards giving you new weapons and equipment customization options for your vehicle builds.

This expansion includes::
>Five miniatures: Five miniatures: Brimstone, Stiletto, Aristocrat, Avalanche, and Jackal. Miniatures are pre-assembled and unpainted.
>148 cards (weapons, accessories, upgrades, structures)
>Four colored bases (red, yellow, blue, and green)

boardgame.name: The Net Zero Game 2050
boardgame.description:
The Net Zero Game 2050 is an event-driven business strategy, sustainability and negotiation board game based on stakeholder capitalism.

The Net Zero Game 2050 gamifies the road towards carbon neutrality in 2050 (or before) by letting each player – four are recommended – become a Business Leader of a portfolio of companies. Each Business Leader may build a team of Green Executives to execute the chosen strategy.

The Net Zero Game 2050 represents a Non-Zero Game where the objective of each Business Leader is to reduce carbon emissions and at the same time increase value creation in order to finance the investments needed to reach zero carbon emissions.

boardgame.name: OSR to Troika! Creature Conversion
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Quick and dirty creature conversions for running D&D-derived OSR adventures with Troika!
boardgame.rpg: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game
Old School Reference and Index Compilation (OSRIC)

boardgame.name: Raise the Roofs
boardgame.description:
How high can you build it? Roll different dice combinations to build towers and earn bonus blocks. Create the tallest combined tower to win the game.

In Raise the Roofs, players take turns rolling the dice up to three times to create different combinations. These combinations are then used to build new towers, add blocks to existing towers, or reduce the height of an opponent's tower. Once gameplay ends, each player combines their towers into a single tower, and the player with the tallest tower wins!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Under Falling Skies: Essen City promo tile
boardgame.description:
Additional city tile released as a promo at Spiel 2021.



Essen (E/B)

Blue side (research 6)

"During setup, place 1 token in each research room. When you resolve a research room that has a token, you may discard the token to apply a +1 bonus.

Red side (research 5)
"During setup, place 1 token in each research room. When you resolve a research room that has a token, you may discard the token to apply a +1 bonus."

boardgame.name: Carcassonne: Bonusplättchen Spiel 2021
boardgame.description:
This single-tile mini-expansion can be added to any Carcassonne game. The design, however, matches that of the New Edition of Carcassonne (2014).

This promo was given out (for free) when making a purchase at the Hans im Glück booth at Spiel 2021, Essen.

No specific rules are included with the tile. The tile is simply mixed with the other landscape tiles. When a player draws the tile, he or she should place the tile according to the usual rules.

boardgame.name: Root the Roleplaying Game: Core Rulebook
Root the RPG: Core Rulebook
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:
Root: The Roleplaying Game is a pen-and-paper tabletop storytelling game. Alongside a few friends, you spin out the stories of roguish vagabonds as they journey throughout the Woodland, acting as something between knaves and heroes!
...
Root: The Roleplaying Game is based on the same fictional world as Root: A Game of Woodland Might and Right, playing with many of the same themes and ideas, but from a different perspective—that of a tabletop roleplaying game focused on the vagabonds themselves.



What Makes Root: The Roleplaying Game Unique?

Root: The Roleplaying Game is a tabletop roleplaying game in which the characters you play are anthropomorphic animal vagabonds—miscreants, rogues, outcasts, and renegade heroes—adventuring across the Woodland. The vagabonds are highly skilled and capable, but they’re not really at home anywhere in the myriad clearings of the Woodland. So they move around, traveling the paths and crossing the dangerous forests, taking jobs for pay and equipment.

Whether they mean to be or not, the vagabonds are often drawn into the overarching conflict between the powerful factions of the Woodland. As those factions wage war against each other, the vagabonds may prove the key to tipping the balance in favor of one faction or the other…or they may act as heroes, protecting the average Woodland denizens from a war that might consume them. Whatever they do and whomever they support is your choice as you play!

listing.notes:
This is the Kickstarter "Both Books and Satchel" Pledge including:
Hardcover Core Book Travelers & Outsiders Hardcover Book Vagabond's Satchel plus all PDFs Equipment Pack Denizens Deck Faction Dice Set Clearing Booklet GM Screen & Campaign Notepads Maps
$3.00 flat rate shipping. Ships next business day after payment clears.

boardgame.name: Root the RPG: Travelers & Outsiders
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:
Travelers & Outsiders is the first supplement for Root: The RPG, a pen-andpaper tabletop roleplaying game based on Root: A Woodland Game of Might and Right, a board game designed by Cole Wehrle and featuring art from Kyle Ferrin. In Root: The RPG, you and your friends take on the role of vagabonds, rogues of the Woodland who act as something between knaves and heroes as they travel from clearing to clearing taking on jobs to make ends meet.

In these pages, you’ll discover a whole new world of adventure—new mechanics, new character types, new systems for the Gamemaster (GM), and more! Each chapter of Travelers & Outsiders builds upon the existing rules of Root: The RPG, adding in expansion factions like the Lizard Cult and the Corvid Conspiracy, and offering new options for players and GMs alike.

Of course, you do need to know how to play Root: The RPG to make use of this book! All of the material here is supplementary—you need a copy of the Root: The RPG core book to get all the rules for playing the core game.

listing.notes: $3.00 flat rate shipping. Ships next business day after payment clears.

boardgame.name: Tug
boardgame.description:
Tug is a 2 player card game played partially on top of the game box.

Two dog owners and their pups compete to tug a rope toy to their side.

Each round, players secretly designate any number of their cards as tug cards and bid cards. Tug cards work to tug the pawn toward their side. The high bidder gets a new upgraded card. Whoever tugs the pawn all the way to their side is the winner! Or collect 2 bone cards which provide no bidding/tugging power for an alternate path to victory.

boardgame.name: Root the RPG: Clearing Booklet
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:
Welcome to the Clearing Booklet!
The Woodland is full of mysteries and ruins, battlefields and outposts, forests and pathways...but it is the clearings of the Woodland that so often draw vagabonds into drama and danger. Any fool can explore a ruin, but only the bravest adventurer gets involved with the complex politics of a local clearing!

This booklet contains four clearings ready to be used in any campaign of Root: The RPG, including:

Hookfoot Bog ·
Sixtoe Stand·
Limmery Post
Coolclaw Mine


Each clearing contains a description, a core conflict, a set of additional conflicts, and lists of important residents (with stats), important locations, and special rules. Finally, each clearing also contains ideas for how to get the vagabonds involved with the clearing’s conflicts when the band first arrives!

boardgame.name: Save Afghanistan, Comrade!
boardgame.description:
A solitaire game of the Soviet war in Afghanistan. Soviet and Afghan regiments and police battle Mujahadeen formations, foreign fighter contingents, and local chiefs and warlords for Provincial control throughout the country.

It is December, 1979. Hafizullah Amin, a dedicated communist, leads Afghanistan ineffectually. In Moscow, the Politburo chafes under his failure to unify an increasingly unraveling ally. The aging Leonid Brezhnev has been slowly persuaded that, absent decisive Russian action, Afghanistan will fall from the Soviet orbit.

In what they see as a quick “regime change”, the Politburo directs Soviet forces to deploy throughout Afghanistan under the guise of assisting Amin. On December 27, 1979, Amin’s palace is stormed and he is shot dead (then grenaded for good measure) and replaced by pliant Soviet puppet Babrak Karmal. Success! Or is it...?

Welcome to the Great Game, Cold War version. “Save Afghanistan, Comrade!” pits you as the Soviets and communist Afghans against the Mujahadeen for dominance there. You have until Summer, 1992 (50 quarterly turns) to clear the Provinces of Mujahadeen to win. Or will you, like Brezhnev, find the Mujahadeen to be an indomitable enemy?

Four colored bases (red, yellow, blue, and green)

boardgame.name: Snowhere
boardgame.description:
Your challenge in Snowhere is to use snow cards to extinguish all the fire in play.

To set up the game, spread the 111 cards fire-side up on the table in a single mass so that none of the cards are separated from one another. On a turn, a player picks up a fire card that is either uncovered or covered by at most a sliver of one other card. Turn the card over. If it shows a giant snowflake, set it aside; otherwise, use it to cover one or more of the fire cards still in play. You cannot cover a fire card one-to-one, but must cover part of the playing area (along with fire) with the snow card or cover part of another snow card already in play.

When a player can no longer remove any fire cards from the table, use any giant snowflakes set aside earlier to cover as much of the remaining fire as possible. The fewer fire cards revealed, the better, and if you have covered all of the fire, then you win.

boardgame.name: Car Wars (Sixth Edition): Miniatures Set 4
boardgame.description:
This expansion for Car Wars Sixth Edition adds new miniatures and cards giving you new weapons and equipment customization options for your vehicle builds.

This expansion includes::

boardgame.name: Splitter
boardgame.description:
In Splitter, you must group numbers together to score points — two 2s, three 3s, and so on — but you're placing two numbers at a time, so things won't always work out.

Each player has their own score sheet with 44 empty spaces on it, with two different patterns of spaces included in the box; each pattern has a dashed line through the middle that splits it into two mirrored halves.

On a turn, someone rolls two six-sided dice. Each player then writes the results, e.g. 1 and 4, in empty spaces in the pattern, with each number being in the mirrored space of the other. If, say, you place the 1 in the leftmost space of the top row, then you must place the 4 in the rightmost space of the top row.

After 22 dice rolls, everyone's pattern will be filled. Each 1 on its own — that is, with no other 1s orthogonally adjacent — scores 1 point; each set of two 2s that have no other orthogonally adjacent 2s score 2 points; and so on up to a set of six 6s with no other orthogonally adjacent 6s being worth 6 points. A starred space is present on each half of the pattern, and a scored group that contains this starred space has its points doubled. (One pattern has a set of three spaces with hearts, and if you fill all three hearts with the same number, you score 5 points.)

Whoever has the highest score wins.

boardgame.name: Mampfender Max
boardgame.description:
Players roll the die and feed acorns of respective colors to Max the Squirrel. If you can't take the right colored acorn from the common pool, you can grab one from a fellow player's board and feed it to Max instead.

Eventually Max is going to spill the acorns to even several different directions. Now players need to try to grab the acorns before other players and fill their board with five acorn slots. The first player to fill their slots wins.

boardgame.name: Tome of Heroes
boardgame.description:
UNRELEASED GAME




This game has not been released yet, therefore some of the information above may change in the future. Until this game is released, please don't submit images for it unless given direct written permission from the publisher which must be noted in the image caption.




From the Kickstarter:

Tome of Heroes for 5th Edition delivers character options galore—heroic choices that have been judged and found worthy! New styles of magic and new weapon options, all-new monk paths, the riverfolk halflings and expanded catfolk, the soulspy rogue, a Path of the Dragon for barbarians, cleric domains—and much more. Discover a beautiful, well-organized tome of 5E DnD character races, backgrounds, and classes to expand your game in new directions! This project yields a wealth of brand-new, carefully developed and playtested material—all of it immediately usable in your next game.

With more than 50 subclasses, from the Way of Concordant Motion monk to the bard’s College of Shadows, your character choices are deeper than ever! Add 10 races—from the catfolk to the gearforged—alongside expansions for existing favorites, like dwarves and elves, to experience new options that push your character concepts in original directions. Then unearth a grimoire of new spells, a full chapter of new equipment suitable for both heroes and villains, and sprinkle in some entirely new schools of magic (liminal magic and portal magic, to name just two stretch goals!) . . . and, well, things are about to get interesting.

boardgame.name: Save South Vietnam!
boardgame.description:
A solitaire game of the US and South Vietnamese war against the Vietcong and North Vietnamese Army. US and ARVN brigades/regiments and police battle VC battalions, NVA regiments, and subversive Political Cadres for Provincial control throughout the country.

It is early 1965. The South Vietnamese government and army (ARVN) are collapsing in the face of growing Vietcong attacks. President Johnson feels he MUST act. On March 8, 1965, the 9th Regiment, 3rd Marine Division, lands at Danang to take over the large base’s defense from ARVN forces who are presumably now free to conduct offensive operations against the VC. US Army units shortly deploy to Bien Hoa and other strategic areas. By fall 1965, the 1st Cavalry Division is engaged in a full-scale offensive in the Ia Drang Valley in Vietnam’s Central Highlands. "Americanization” of the war has begun. Before it's over 10 years later, Cambodia and Laos are dragged into the struggle. US forces leave Vietnam in 1973 having never lost a sizable battle, but South Vietnam quickly falls nonetheless, in early 1975.

Welcome back to 1965, now YOU are in command! The ARVN has basically collapsed and the North Vietnamese Army is infiltrating the south in large numbers even as local VC forces grow in strength. If you can hold Saigon until Summer 1977 (50 quarterly turns), the communists will be totally spent - Victory! Or will you, like Johnson and Nixon, find the VC and NVA impossible to completely defeat?
